availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Abel Newbrough (Hopkins County Boot and Shoe maker)

body.p: A Kentucky shoe and boot maker. Lived in Hopkins County in 1860. Married to Susan Newbrough. Received Patent No. 49,138 for a churn in 1865.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 248; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District No. 1; Annual Report of the Commissioner of patents for the Year 1865, vol. 2 (Washington: Government Printing Office, 1867), 591; "Abel Newbraugh, (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=66895698&ref=acom) (accessed on March 22, 2017).
